required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound and Near Infrared Imaging for Predicting and Monitoring Neoadjuvant Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound and Near Infrared Imaging for Predicting and Monitoring Neoadjuvant Treatment

collaborator.agency: National Institute for Biomedical Imaging and Bioengineering (NIBIB)

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the accuracy of NIR/US assessment of tumor vasculature and oxygen changes in predicting and monitoring early neoadjuvant treatment response compared to pathological response.

primary_outcome.measure: Pathologic Response Based on Miller-Payne Grading System
primary_outcome.description: In the Miller-Payne system, the pathologic response is divided into 5 grades based on comparison of tumor cellularity between pre-neoadjuvant core biopsy and definitive surgical specimen as: grade 1: no change or some alteration to individual malignant cells but no reduction in overall cellularity (pNR) grade 2: a minor loss of tumor cells but overall cellularity still high; up to 30% (pPR) grade 3: between an estimated 30% and 90% reduction in tumor cells (pPR) grade 4: a marked disappearance of tumor cells such that only small clusters or widely dispersed individual cells remain (almost pCR); more than 90% loss of tumor cells grade 5: no malignant cells identifiable in sections from the site of the tumor; only vascular fibroelastonic stroma remains often containing macrophages (pCR) (however, ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) may be present)

arm_group.description: Patients will have the NIR/US baseline scan performed before their first treatment. The desirable schedule will be >= 7 days after initial biopsy to avoid confounding effects from the biopsy related acute inflammatory response. In addition, patients will also have NIR/US performed at end of cycle 1, end of cycle 2, end of cycle 3, end of cycle 5 (only if treatment regimen changed), and prior to surgery. The number of NIR/US study visits may vary (5-6) depending on the patient's treatment regimen

Patients will have the NIR/US baseline scan performed before their first treatment. The desirable schedule will be >= 7 days after initial biopsy to avoid confounding effects from the biopsy related acute inflammatory response. In addition, patients will also have NIR/US performed at end of cycle 1, end of cycle 2, end of cycle 3, at time of treatment regimen change (only intended for those who have had a change in their regimen), and prior to surgery. The number of NIR/US study visits may vary (5-6) depending on the patient's treatment regimen

intervention.intervention_name: Optical Tomography Using Near Infrared Diffused Light Assisted with Ultrasound

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled to receive neoadjuvant chemotherapy for the treatment of newly diagnosed, locally advanced breast cancer or scheduled to receive neoadjuvant endocrine therapy with the eventual goal of surgery of newly diagnosed clinical stage II-III ER+ HER2- breast cancer (for the endocrine therapy cohort)
- At least 18 years of age
- Female
- Able to understand and willing to sign an IRB-approved written informed consent document
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant and/or breastfeeding
- Prior history of breast cancer
- Prior history of chest wall radiation
- Prior history of breast reconstruction, reduction, or augmentation

link.description: Alvin J. Siteman Cancer Center at Barnes-Jewish Hospital and Washington University School of Medicine

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: An additional arm (NIR/US - Crossover from Endocrine Cohort to Chemotherapy Cohort) was added for results reporting as one participant transitioned from the Endocrine Cohort to the Chemotherapy Cohort because the participant's therapy was changed mid-treatment from Endocrine to Chemotherapy.

group.title: NIR/US (Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy Cohort)
group.description: Patients will have the NIR/US baseline scan performed before their first treatment. The desirable schedule will be >= 7 days after initial biopsy to avoid confounding effects from the biopsy related acute inflammatory response. In addition, patients will also have NIR/US performed at end of cycle 1, end of cycle 2, end of cycle 3, end of cycle 5 (only if treatment regimen changed), and prior to surgery. The number of NIR/US study visits may vary (5-6) depending on the patient's treatment regimen

In addition, patients will also have NIR/US performed at end of cycle 1, end of cycle 2, end of cycle 3, at time of treatment regimen change (only intended for those who have had a change in their regimen), and prior to surgery. The number of NIR/US study visits may vary (5-6) depending on the patient's treatment regimen

group.description: Patients will have the NIR/US baseline scan performed before their first treatment. In addition, patients will also have NIR/US performed at end of cycle 1, end of cycle 2, end of cycle 3, at time of treatment regimen change (only intended for those who have had a change in their regimen), and prior to surgery. The number of NIR/US study visits may vary (5-6) depending on the patient's treatment regimen

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not complete all timepoints in Endocrine Cohort
Developed metastases prior to completing neoadjuvant therapy
Taken off study after first imaging appointment

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Pathologic Response Based on Miller-Payne Grading System
outcome.description: In the Miller-Payne system, the pathologic response is divided into 5 grades based on comparison of tumor cellularity between pre-neoadjuvant core biopsy and definitive surgical specimen as: grade 1: no change or some alteration to individual malignant cells but no reduction in overall cellularity (pNR) grade 2: a minor loss of tumor cells but overall cellularity still high; up to 30% (pPR) grade 3: between an estimated 30% and 90% reduction in tumor cells (pPR) grade 4: a marked disappearance of tumor cells such that only small clusters or widely dispersed individual cells remain (almost pCR); more than 90% loss of tumor cells grade 5: no malignant cells identifiable in sections from the site of the tumor; only vascular fibroelastonic stroma remains often containing macrophages (pCR) (however, ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) may be present)
outcome.population: For this outcome measure, the one participant who was in the crossover cohort was counted in the neoadjuvant chemotherapy cohort. Three participants in the neoadjuvant chemotherapy cohort were not evaluable for this outcome measure (2 developed metastases prior to completing neoadjuvant therapy and 1 was taken off study after first imaging appointment).

group.title: NIR/US (Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy Cohort)
group.description: Patients will have the NIR/US baseline scan performed before their first treatment. The desirable schedule will be >= 7 days after initial biopsy to avoid confounding effects from the biopsy related acute inflammatory response. In addition, patients will also have NIR/US performed at end of cycle 1, end of cycle 2, end of cycle 3, end of cycle 5 (only if treatment regimen changed), and prior to surgery. The number of NIR/US study visits may vary (5-6) depending on the patient's treatment regimen

In addition, patients will also have NIR/US performed at end of cycle 1, end of cycle 2, end of cycle 3, at time of treatment regimen change (only intended for those who have had a change in their regimen), and prior to surgery. The number of NIR/US study visits may vary (5-6) depending on the patient's treatment regimen

measure.title: Pathologic Response Based on Miller-Payne Grading System
measure.description: In the Miller-Payne system, the pathologic response is divided into 5 grades based on comparison of tumor cellularity between pre-neoadjuvant core biopsy and definitive surgical specimen as: grade 1: no change or some alteration to individual malignant cells but no reduction in overall cellularity (pNR) grade 2: a minor loss of tumor cells but overall cellularity still high; up to 30% (pPR) grade 3: between an estimated 30% and 90% reduction in tumor cells (pPR) grade 4: a marked disappearance of tumor cells such that only small clusters or widely dispersed individual cells remain (almost pCR); more than 90% loss of tumor cells grade 5: no malignant cells identifiable in sections from the site of the tumor; only vascular fibroelastonic stroma remains often containing macrophages (pCR) (however, ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) may be present)
measure.population: For this outcome measure, the one participant who was in the crossover cohort was counted in the neoadjuvant chemotherapy cohort. Three participants in the neoadjuvant chemotherapy cohort were not evaluable for this outcome measure (2 developed metastases prior to completing neoadjuvant therapy and 1 was taken off study after first imaging appointment).

reported_events.time_frame: Serious adverse events that occurred within 24 hours of the NIR/US were collected and reported, assessed up to 6 months (~6 months)
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were not collected for this study. If a serious adverse event was suspected to be caused by the NIR/US scan then it was collected and reported.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
